title-group.article-title: An Empirical Tire Model for Non-steady State Side Slip Properties

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 2004 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: In this paper, on the basis of the extant semi-empirical tire models of non-steady state with pure yaw angle input and pure side slip angle input, two empirical tire models of non-steady state side slip properties are established, one is pure yaw angle input, the other is pure side slip angle input, and both of them have been verified by test data. These two models can be used to approximately express tire force within low frequency. They have their own advantages, and make up for the disadvantages of existing tire models. They provide more choice for the simulation of vehicle dynamics.

ref.mixed-citation: H.B.Pacejka. The Role of Tyre Dynamic Properties, pp55~68, Smart Vehicles. Swets & Zeitlinger Publishers, 1995.
Konghui Guo, Yongping Hou. The Semi-Empirical Tire Model of Non-Steady State Cornering Characteristics, Automotive Engineering, Vol.21, No.3, Paper99023, 1999
Yongping Hou, Chenggang Li, Konghui Guo. A Semi- Empirical Tire Model of Non-Steady State Side Slip Properties, Transactions of the Chinese Society of Agriculture Engineering, Vol.16, No.6, 2000.
Yongping Hou. "A Study of Non-Linear Non-steady State Side Slip Property of Tire and Its Semi-Empirical Model", Ph. D thesis, Jilin University of Technology, 1999.
Qing Liu, Analysis, modeling and simulation of side slip properties of tire non-steady state, [Doctorial Dissertation], Changcun: Jilin University of Technology, Mar.1996.
